summary: Resistance bands are new for me so I went to google for help with this workout. Do each exercise 12-15 reps, for 3 sets. Rest...
body:
Resistance bands are new for me so I went to google for help with this workout. Do each exercise 12-15 reps, for 3 sets. Rest two minutes in between sets.

Seated Row

Sit on a bench and secure the middle of the band to a stationary object in front of you. Grasp the end of the band with your elbows extended in front and pull the bands toward your lower ribs, bending your elbows. Slowly return.

Reverse Fly

Secure the middle of the band to a stationary object at shoulder height. Face the attachment point. Using a staggered step with one leg slightly in front of the other, grasp the ends of the band with your elbows straight. Keep your elbows straight and pull the ends of the band outward. Slowly return.

Lat Pull-Down

Secure the middle of the band to a stationary object above shoulder height. Face the attachment point. Using a staggered step with one leg slightly in front of the other, grasp the ends of the band above shoulder height with your elbows extended in front. Bend your elbows and bring your hands to your chest, pulling the bands down and back. Slowly return.

Shrug

Stand on the middle of a long band or tubing with both feet. Grasp the ends of the band at hip height. Keep your elbows straight and shrug your shoulders. Slowly return.

Bent Over Row

Use a staggered step with one leg in front of the other. Stand on the middle of the band or tubing with your front foot. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight. Grasp the end of the band with your elbow straight. Pull one end of the band upward by bending the elbows, bringing your hand to your trunk. Slowly return.

Linton External Rotation

Begin by kneeling with the band or tubing secured under one hand and maintaining tension with the other hand, forearm on your abdomen. Start the exercise by externally rotating the shoulder, then abduct and extend the arm simultaneously, pointing your thumb toward the ceiling. Hold; then slowly return, first bringing your elbow into your side.

Bilateral Extension with Retraction

Securely attach the middle of the band to a sturdy object in front of you. Grasp the ends of the band at hip height with your elbows straight and palms forward. Extend your arms backward and pinch your shoulder blades together against the band. Slowly return.

High Row

Secure the middle of the band to a stationary object in front of you at shoulder height. Grasp the ends of the band with your elbows extended and pull the bands toward your chest, bending your elbows. Slowly return.

Full Workout Here–

https://www.fitsimplify.com/resistance-band-chest-back-training-guide/


Tag List— @buckysbrat @ravensonata @thorohdamnson @princess-evans-addict @badassbaker @mittenskittie @ishipmybed @qnzdiamond104 @stanclub @ruinerofcheese @tropicalcap @aglarelen @anon-pancake @redqueen1221

blog.title: Eclectic
blog.description:
Popular culture, wildlife, history, anything that floats my boat and the occasional rant.
I used to edit an AC/DC fanzine, am an artist, photographer and occasional writer. Current occupation, working with tourists and giving talks about the Titanic in Southampton.

blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

hey there my name is anna, I write stuff, die for 79 months and then write more stuff.

I don’t write for pennywise, you’ll have to go somewhere else to get ur clown rocks off

I also don’t write for the bowers gang. I do however write slash and reader specific imagines :)

when I finally get my inbox cleared out, feel free to send me a request <3

body:
Marvel Theory:

What if Captain Marvel is somehow responsible for Nick Fury losing an eye?

“Last time I trusted someone I lost an eye.”

It would explain why he didn’t call her in before, too - if he was so angry at her that she was an absolute last resort.

(This is just a theory, be gentle with me as I haven’t read any of the comics).

title: #3: It Must Be the Girl
body:
We read a small handful of comics covering the story of the explosion that gives Carol her powers. Spoiler alert: it’s a little anti-climactic. Topics of discussion include Batman, Rick Jones, whether or not Carol inherited Mar-Vell’s powers, platonically swapping DNA, and the Mystery of Zo. Join us for reading the 1968 Captain Marvel #15-18, plus a little discussion on the 2012 Captain Marvel #1 and #3, and The Mighty Captain Marvel #0!


Check out this episode!
